titleStmt.title: John H. Powell to James F. Robinson
CWG8865

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Frankfort. June 6. 1863
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned, Petitioner to your Excellency, respectfully represents -- that on the 2d day of June, a boy named Kirk, without permission, took possession of a skiff, beloning to the undersigned, and while in possession, seriously damaged the same by running ^over the Dam^ The petitioner feeling outraged, made an attack on said Kirk and punished him for which he was fined to the amount -- of five dollars and costs.
In consequence of the exasperation caused by the seizure of the skiff and the subsequent damages Your petitioner implores Your Excellency to remit the fine --
We the subscribers recommend the Petitioner to your clemency

Jas P. O'Hara
Ben. S, Myers
G, W, Mathews
Wm H. Greenup
J B. F. Johnson
J A Crittenden
Fine in this case is remitted 6 June 1863

J F Robinson
Jno. H. Powell
Issd June 6. 1863
